column3: I only performed the most trivial of tests.  I am opening this PR somewhat prematurely because I don't know why it wasn't done this way in the first place, and wanted to find out if there was some huge reason I was missing before I spent more time testing. :)\n

Nice!

Right. I should have this done in the fist place.

utACK.
There is also a PR that would optimize importing depth:\nhttps://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6570\n
Awesome. Okay I'll run it through some more test cases then!\n
I've tested this more extensively now and can't seem to break it.\n
Maybe "Wallet rescanning is disabled in pruned mode"?\n

Technically it is the blockchain that is rescanned.  But these options have a boolean parameter "rescan" which defaults, so what its saying is that this option is disabled.\n\nI think if I were to clarify this further I would say that the rescan option was disabled. Or maybe to be kind to translaters say something like the requested rescan depth was too deep (as I expect we'll further parameterize
You could just say "The -rescan option is disabled in pruned mode" which would be more clear (to me at least :)\n
But this isn't about the -rescan option, but rescans triggered some other way. I think the message is OK.\n

The only improvement I can think of would be to add a comment to the error message that it is possible to pass 'false' as the rescan parameter to avoid this error.

You don't have to worry about translators, RPC error messages aren't translated.
